I saw the movie yesterday While watching I started feeling somehow surprised but in a negative way At the end I wa just disappointed I wa waiting for that movie a long time a I am a Queen and Freddy fan a well The movie go really fast and it give a sense of a non refined plot Real fact all the fan around the world know go upside down or even just omitted from the movie Some example The way Freddie met Mary Austin seems like they had already know each other And if I am not wrong Freddy wa introduced to Mary or vice versa by Brian something that is not shown in the movie Another wtf thing is that the director show a very early success of the group before A Night at the Opera year of 1975 which wa the actual turning point forward to their success by giving scene of gig with huge crowd even already being familiar with some of the band then hit A small detail the song Fat Bottomed Girls is listened in the movie in the year of 1976 I think even if this wa a Jazz album song issued in 1979 Then the director suddenly jump from 1976 to the moustache era of Freddy in 1980 No reference to the collaboration with David Bowie at all in making Under Pressure in 1981 No reference to the almost but never complete collaboration with Michael Jackson the same period The top of the iceberg the movie wa indeed such a cold shower is that towards the end of the movie little before the Live Aid performance there s a scene where Freddy call the group back a they were dismissed after a rehearsal and tell them that he had AIDS Absolute falsification of the truth All the people being aware of Freddy s basic bio fact know that he didn t know of his HIV infection not earlier than the last 3 4 month of 1986 The fact that he may wa concerned way longer about that doesn t change that fact and of course the fact that he didn t tell to anybody about his health issue before he wa officially diagnosed And a few day before Live Aid is way too far from that day As an overall sense despite the fact that the movie ha some well shooted scene especially the Live Aid reproduction and Rami Malek play his role pretty well not perfect though in my opinion at the end it s like the movie wa targetting to a beginner of the whole Queen and F M story

My stepfather wa Vice President of a small record company on Music Row in Nashville Tn when I wa 14 in 1978 When I heard that Queen wa coming to our Municipal Auditorium I wa excited I had never asked my stepdad to pull any string before regarding ticket to see band but my girlfriend wanted to see them badly a I did too So after asking him the favor a couple week later he come home handing me a rectangular white box When I opened it their were two ticket along with a card for back stage admittance I about killed over I told my girlfriend about the ticket but held the backstage a secret You should have seen her face when I led her by the hand to see the band She almost started cry It wa one of the best memory a a teenager and of my life Miss Freddy Mercury and his great voice Cant wait to see the movie

Lots of Sacha Baron Cohen fan still arguing he would have been a better Freddie It s pointless to argue and try to change their mind respect their opinion and move on Whether Cohen would have delivered a better acting performance than Malek in playing a believable Freddie we may never know but read these comment from the band member google the quote below to find the article I m not making this up May in an interview with Classic Rock magazine also talked about why Cohen and the project parted company We the band felt that his presence in the movie would be very distracting referencing the star s outstanding performance in The Dictator Les Miserables and Hugo a being very much Sacha Baron Cohen performance Said May And we thought there ha to be no distraction in the Freddie movie You have to really suspend that disbelief The man who play Freddie you have to really believe is Freddie And we didn t feel that could really happen with Sacha Casting opinion from the band member themselves carry more weight than anybody else yes They ve seen Cohen audition a Freddie we haven t They personally knew Freddie we didn t They know what work for them a Queen They are more qualified than anybody here to determine whether actor A B or C would be compelling a Freddie Let s just enjoy the movie in it entirety and argue le about who is playing Freddie If the movie is a amazing a these two trailer were this movie will be huge It will be a movie that doe justice to Queen It will be a movie that doe justice to Freddie Mercury Brian May Roger Taylor and John Deacon all of them at the same time This is the story of a graphic designer who designed the Queen crest with an uncanny ability to engage an entire concert audience an aspiring astrophysicist who later returned and completed the PhD in 2007 an aspiring dentist who wa asked back in 1970 by Peter Gabriel to join Genesis but declined paving the way for Phil Collins career in Genesis and an electrical engineer who created the iconic Deacy Amp for Brian May s guitar sound The story of Queen is amazing yet tragic yet inspring in the end and I can t wait to see the movie

Whilst I m really looking forward to the film I feel a if this trailer suggests the film focus more on Brian May and Roger Taylor whilst neglecting John Deacon I mean John only appears at the briefest moment and we literally never hear him speak either in the teaser trailer or this one Whereas Brian is shown in this really positive and dramatic light showing how he had the idea for We Will Rock You Roger is shown a a drama queen but in a really funny way and both he and Brian s positive relationship with Freddie is made obvious It s sad because John wa said to have had a close friendship with Freddie also to the point where he did not carry on with Queen after Freddie died because he felt Queen wa not the same without him I just hope that despite Brian and Roger s supposed fractured relationship with John and with the pair of them being so involved in the making of this movie that they can still include John s contribution to the band Don t get me wrong I love all the band member I just hope it work s fair to all of them ☺

This is a wonderful idea but I hope to god this isn t another Mamma Mia in execution Don t get me wrong I love this band but it might not work if all the song are hamfisted in and abrupt Also if this is a musical there s a major problem Singing out of plot Like a lot of the song in Mamma Mia can work out with musical and it make sense They all suddenly sing everyone can magically dance I won t comment on the logistics of it all But there are problem when you mix this with a band Is the band singing IN the movie half the time or are they singing out of plot Are we hearing a real performance that they re supposedly putting on or are we hearing a classic out of plot song and the setting of said song is in a concert hall This sound dumb yes why would they be performing an out of plot song if they re a band in a movie Well there are many way this can happen Think back to The Greatest Showman Never Enough It wa a generic pop song in a time when two people couldn t date if they were different race I hope this movie doesn t do anything similar to that but that s just one example of a mix up That song Never Enough wa being performed but the question is wa it actually pop in the plot Was the song she wa singing just turned into pop for u to enjoy it If it were pop in that time frame it would not have worked at all It wa a very strange mix up What if there s a moment in this movie where they re not at a performance but just at an event or something and they start playing a song Everyone dance etc etc Are we meant to believe that s a part of the plot or it s just another song shoved in It might just get confusing Either way I ll still watch this movie just wanted to bring that up

I am in a quandary here During their reign on the chart I wa never a fan of their style of music which I m thinking hard rock or theatrical rock I can ditto Elton John David Bowie Freddie Mercury s orientation wa unknown to me at the time Ditto Elton David The type of music I listened to wa R B going back to the early 1960 s to this time period Disco which I loved came later The concept of LGBTQ music didn t exist I never gave thought to that genre until the present Steve Grand Years Years Brendan Stansell Ria Mae are just some of the current musician I ve been buying CD s of At age 70 I don t attend film especially that I use a walker plus going alone is no fun Should I want to see a movie I wait until the DVD come out Love Simon for instance The story line may be the impetus for me to purchase the DVD on release rather than the music Big question Would one consider Queen to be part of the LGBTQ genre like those I ve mentioned
